column13: The Milton Foundation is dedicated to supporting disadvantaged members of the community. The Foundation started in 1988, was acquired through the merger of WHSP and Milton in 2021, and has now grown to $2.5 million in net assets, supporting a distribution of $180,000 in FY23 (FY22: $130,000).
column20: Philanthropy, Community Support, Mental Health Research

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In June 2023, WHSP donated $100,000 to the Black Dog Institute (BDI) to support the world's first Future Proofing Study, representing the most extensive longitudinal study to prevent depression and anxiety in young people. This funding enables the employment of a researcher for one year to help fill critical research gaps, investigate strategies to improve youth mental health and deliver interventions at scale.
column20: Philanthropy, Mental Health Research Funding, Longitudinal Study

column13: Developing the next generation of talent is also a priority, with a cadetship program recently launched. Shiva Shanmugam completed a Bachelor of Science majoring in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology and a Bachelor of Advanced Studies in Agriculture. Arriving at the Mildura Citrus orchard to start her cadetship in early 2023, Shiva represents the next generation of horticultural expertise and was attracted to a farm like Mildura Ã¢ÂÂ a 358-ha group of citrus orchards in Colighan, Victoria Ã¢ÂÂ producing premium quality table citrus with technological and scientific advancements to optimise crop growth and production.

column7: Almost all new suppliers must complete the questionnaire to Soul Patts' satisfaction to be onboarded successfully. The only suppliers not required to complete the questionnaire are sole traders or boutique professional services professionals.

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: Strengthening compliance around our supplier onboarding process (including establishing a supplier register) as part of our commitment to modern slavery and other regulatory compliance (including cyber security, climate risk, data privacy, anti-money laundering, and workplace inclusivity)
column20: Supplier Compliance, Modern Slavery, Regulatory Compliance

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: In FY23, we obtained an external review of our supplier's onboarding system. It involved an update to our supplier onboarding questionnaire to include questions extending beyond modern slavery, relating to sustainability, diversity, cyber risk data privacy and anti-bribery and corruption.
column20: Supplier Onboarding, Sustainability, Diversity, Cyber Risk

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: To address supply chain risk, we conducted the FairSupply analysis to identify where we are exposed to modern slavery risk in our supply chain. While demonstrating that most of our suppliers are low risk, the results of this exercise exposed where our risk currently lies and is likely to lie in the future. It assists us in further mitigating our modern slavery risk exposure through a range of actions.
column20: Supply Chain Risk, Modern Slavery Risk, FairSupply Analysis

column13: Completing a cyber security review in conjunction with our external cyber team, resulting in the introduction of monthly security awareness training for all employees; more robust security and monitoring; completion of independent External Penetration Testing for identifying and closing out vulnerabilities; deployment of Sophos Managed Detection and Response (MDR) to all company devices and servers which enhances threat detection and response capabilities, 24/7; updating our Disaster Recovery Policy and Disaster Recovery testing; implementing Zero Trust Network Access for our Enterprise Resource Planning system; increased collaboration with our controlled investments on improving overall cyber defence.
column20: Cyber Security, Security Awareness Training, Penetration Testing
